item.title: Covfefe
item.description: Final Assignment Table of Contents Libraries loading Exercise 3 Data import Three exploratory plots Overall distribution Hourly distribution Bad or Good? Trump or Staff? Rregression analysis Different periods -> different beheaviours? Exercise 4 Preparatory work libs <- c("tidyverse","rio","lubridate","tidytext","stringr","wordcloud","fmsb","scales","sjmisc","sjPlot", "ggpubr") invisible(lapply(libs, library, character.only = T)) Exercise 3 3.0 Data import/ text mining We’ll use Trump’s Tweets dataset, which includes tweets from 2009 to 2017.

item.title: Shiny elections
item.description: Italy’s 2016 and 2021 elections. Since 1993, Italians vote for mayors and city councils’ renewals. Those local governing bodies stay in charge for a five-year term, but they can be disbanded beforehand under precise causes defined by law. The limitation to only two electoral turnout is due to my shiny’s server limited resources. However, the database could be extended to the whole data available. Data source: Ministry of the Interior

item.title: Nurture or nature
item.description: Analysing the correlation between mother’s IQ and Kid’s scores. DISCLAIMER: That’s an assignment made during a Data Analysis course. None of the proposed relationships has been based on a literature review or scientific research. The scope is solely to learn R. 0. Preparatory work library(shiny) library(tidyverse) library(rio) path <- "https://github.com/n-oise/kidiq/blob/main/kidiq.dta?raw=true" 1. Load the data in R Import the data and check if they have been correctly loaded:
